titles.title: Providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 89) requesting the President to submit a budget for fiscal year 1998 that would balance the Federal budget by fiscal year 2002 without relying on budgetary contingencies.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-18, by Mr. Solomon.

Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 89 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for the consideration of the resolution in the House. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 6.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 200 (Roll no. 41).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 202 (Roll No. 42).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/11/1997--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H. Res. 89 (Federal balanced budget).
